Transportation Cost Visualization

Description

This visualization shows household transportation cost predictions in the Edmonton Central Metropolitan Area according to 3 city plans.

Each drawn dot represents 1 household. Due to the large volume of data, only 50% of households per scenario are shown (a uniformly random sample).

The data is produced for the entire CMA, but only Edmonton and St. Albert data is being considered because residential parcel boundary files are not yet available for other regions.

Now Scenario (2020) is based on current population and transportation trends. It includes 431,380 households (215,690 shown).

Business as Usual Scenario (2065) is a prediction of the CMA in 2065. This scenario forecasts an auto-oriented city with more urban sprawl. It includes 711,158 households (355,579 shown).

City Preferred Scenario (2065) is a prediction of the CMA in 2065. This scenario forecasts a city that is more transit-oriented with less urban sprawl. It includes 809,922 households (404,961 shown).

Analysis

To calculate the monthly transportation cost for each household, several daily trip and household data points are compounded:

  • The average cost of owning and maintaining 1 vehicle is set to $3750/year.
  • The cost per vehicle kilometer travelled is $0.225. 17.5 cents for fuel + 5 cents for depreciation and marginal insurance.
  • On average, 330 days of the year will require vehicle travel (if a vehicle is used for commuting).
  • On average, 300 days of the year will require transit travel (if transit is used for commuting).
  • The average cost for a vehicle license is $25/year.
  • The average transit fare is $3.00 (without a transit pass). Fare is $3.50 for individual trips. Books of 10 tickets are $25.00 on average.
  • Transit pass costs vary by person type:
